poem:
**Sandpit Lane**

In the damp embrace  
of moor and wood,  
a scandi-cabin whispers—  
its pine skin  
gleaming in the low cloud,  
rowdy winds  
singing rain-songs  
to hollow branches  
as I walk,  
swift footprints vanishing  
behind me,  
the forest echoing  
life within its  
swaying,  
swaying chest.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "From cool cabins to country houses: six of Britain’s best forest escapes Scandi-style cabin in the North York Moors There are days when a walk in the woods is the best option. This includes days when the cloud ceiling is barely above chest height and there is a rowdy wind driving the rain in your face. I am striding fast up Sandpit Lane near the hamlet of Thimbleby on the west side of the North". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
